meanings.definition: To fill in or make level with a thin piece of material
meanings.sent1: He shimmed the wobbly table leg with a small piece of cardboard.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter shimmed the window frame to ensure it was straight.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel shimmed the gap in the fence with a leaf to sneak into the garden.
meanings.sent4: She shimmed her way through the crowded room, gracefully avoiding obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The student shimmed the missing piece of the puzzle, finally completing the picture.

meanings.definition: To adjust or align using a shim
meanings.sent1: The mechanic shimmed the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She shimmed the door to stop it from creaking every time it was opened.
meanings.sent3: The robot shimmed its circuits to improve its processing speed.
meanings.sent4: He carefully shimmed the gears of the clock, ensuring perfect timekeeping.
meanings.sent5: The dancer shimmed her movements to the rhythm of the music, creating a mesmerizing performance.
